title: How to Make a Raw Vegan Brownie

steps.headline: Soak the hazelnuts overnight in water.
Drain the hazelnuts and rinse under running water in the morning.
Place the hazelnuts into a food processor.
Split the vanilla bean down its length using a sharp knife.
steps.description: Scrape the seeds out and put them in the food processor with the hazelnuts.

steps.headline: Add the dates and salt into the hazelnut mixture.
steps.description: Process again until all the ingredients are well blended.There should still be obvious pieces of hazelnuts. If the mixture seems too crumbly, stiff, or dry, add a little water. Err on the side of less water, as you can always add more if needed.

steps.headline: Remove the mix from the food processor and press it into the cake pan.
Place the brownie into the refrigerator.
steps.description: Allow it to chill. Once chilled, it's ready to serve for dessert or a snack by cutting the brownie into or fingers or squares

text: Soak the hazelnuts overnight in water.  Drain the hazelnuts and rinse under running water in the morning.  Place the hazelnuts into a food processor. Grind them coarsely. Split the vanilla bean down its length using a sharp knife. Scrape the seeds out and put them in the food processor with the hazelnuts. Add the dates and salt into the hazelnut mixture. Process again until all the ingredients are well blended.There should still be obvious pieces of hazelnuts. If the mixture seems too crumbly, stiff, or dry, add a little water. Err on the side of less water, as you can always add more if needed. Prepare the cake pan. Line with parchment paper. Remove the mix from the food processor and press it into the cake pan.  Place the brownie into the refrigerator. Allow it to chill. Once chilled, it's ready to serve for dessert or a snack by cutting the brownie into or fingers or squares
